s.text: well, it's a small program, actually, that puts a small box on your Windows desktop.
Slate proudly announces Slate Explorer, a new way to navigate through the delights of slate.com.

"Beta" is a software industry term for a product that is perhaps just a teensy bit short of absolute perfection, but is being released anyway because we just can't wait anymore--or rather, because we want to let the software-using community share in the excitement of finding any last-minute bugs.
Sounds too good to be true?
We think it's pretty darn cool (a technical software industry term, used to imply strong feelings of affirmation), and hope you will as well.
We're reasonably sure that Slate Explorer won't cause your computer to explode, or to charge large sums to your Visa card, or to take up smoking, or to insult a police officer.
We're reasonably sure that Slate Explorer won't cause your computer to explode, or to charge large sums to your Visa card, or to take up smoking, or to insult a police officer.
But to be fair, it doesn't work on Windows 3.1 either.
But to be fair, it doesn't work on Windows 3.1 either.
It's your chance to tell us what you think about Slate and how you might like to see it improve.
It's your chance to tell us what you think about Slate and how you might like to see it improve.
